pages.title: ℧ Knight of Cups ℧
pages.text: Heir of the Waves and Waters$(br)      ∆ Fire of ∇ Water

Graceful, and peaceful; the Knight of Cups rides a white horse quietly, holding out a golden chalice as if in salutation.$(br)  They wear a winged helmet, a sign of their soaring imagination; and winged boots, the ability to tread lightly.$(br)  A river flows through the terrain, symbolizing the power of emotions and inspiration to carve a set path in life over time.$(br)  A knight is often a heroic warrior that fights and

resists, yet here they embrace the basic nature of elemental Water, that is, to yield and transform.$(br)  They are a dreamer, but the images of the side of sense haunt their sight. They feel a contradiction between their own vision and the demands of their place in the world.$(br)  Grace is called on to deal with the demands of the world without spilling our cupful.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Sensibility, approach.$(br)  Can mean a dreamer, whose dreams conflict with the pressures and responsibilities of everyday life; or an inconsistent person that may find it hard to fully be in commitment.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Subtlety, duplicity.$(br)  May mean a person whose distracted, introverted side intensifies; they may resent demands people make on them.
